ygData.subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Latest Patch
ygData.msgSnippet: Bael Sorry I meant to imply that alot of other tank classes are just starting to learn their tank roles at mid 30s...not yourself.  My apologies if it came
ygData.messageBody:
Bael

Sorry I meant to imply that alot of other tank classes are just starting to learn their tank roles at mid 30s...not yourself.  My apologies if it came across the wrong way.

In  the suggestion department, I believe you a reasonably equipped for your lvl.  Perhaps in the weapon department you might wish to pursue a yak (8/24..1kpp roughly), an EBW (7/21..boring but easy camp in Mistmore with a good group) or if you can scrouge the bucks a Wurmslayer (25/40..5-6kpp).  I'm unfamiliar with a great deal of Velious so I'll let others suggest weapons from there.  If you wish to outagro other tank classes you are going to need to pursue dual wield as a way of life combined with a haste item of some sort.

For equipment you may wish to obtain a Kerran Toy for your ranged slot (AC3 plus 2 agi..very easy quest), a straw spun belt (AC10..very cheap), the cougar claw earrings (AC4?...I forget but campable at your lvl), the fine plate collar & gorget (AC 7 & 8 respectively & cheap to obtain).  Also from Mistmore you may wish to try for an HBC (AC10) if you can get a strong group of mid 30s together.

regards

Flair Shieldrender
54 Champion Fennin Ro

The Mad Macinchaote wrote:
I've been using icetooth's claws main hand and a SSoY off hand, since 41 or so, I'm at 45 now and it seems to work fine. I have a Jarsanth Battle Sword I use occasionally, but I generally just like the faster 1hs's better. Yak procs still turn the giants around on me about half the time they go off, kiting with a druid friend. I'm using a mithril BP, and a mix of stats related gear, pushing my dex and agi, and str very high, for a wood elf. Again, talking about GD frost giants, they hit successfully maybe 15% of the time, Shardwurms maybe 30%. Smarter critters like certain orcs in the EW Ry'gorr fort hit considerably more often, and hard, so that's when you thank the healers.
----- Original Message -----
From:Tom Swift
To:warriors_eq@yahoogroups.com
Sent: Thursday, February 22, 2001 1:01 PM
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Latest Patch

I am pretty comfortable in a group with my warrior at level 36.  I've known my role in a group all along.  I started grouping almost exclusively at around level 15, though I can still solo a bit if I pick my locations carefully. Currently I am doing soloing in Lower Guk live side if I can't get a group.   I really am trying to get in on Lord or Frenzy (Ha! good luck). My exec axe is not as effective for me as it was at 30.  Soloing it doesn't swing often enough to do the damage fast enough.  I think I am underequipped in 1hs also using a enamelled black mace and a obsidian scimitar.  Perhaps its just because it seems everyone I group with has better weapons then I do.
 
Anyone have suggestions as to what weapons I should acquire.  I was planning on a mithril 2-hander so I can keep an AC belt on instead of an FBSS. Other suggestions are welcome.
 
I am well equipped armor wise (I think), but I am cash poor.
Armor:
Treeweave
crafted arms, legs, bracers, gauntlets, boots, Black iron belt
trying to get some orc fang earrings...sold my +4 str +2 int earrings
got 2 jagged bands
skull shaped barbute
 
Advice is welcome.
 
Bael
Tier'dal Warrior 36th Level
on Bertoxxulus
 
 
----- Original Message -----
From:Robert Wilbarg
To:warriors_eq@yahoogroups.com
Sent: February 21, 2001 10:38 PM
Subject: Re: [warriors_eq] Latest Patch

Ok I have a couple of insights into this from a high level warrior perspective:.

1) My warrior at 54 still tanks very well with the 58/59 Pallies & SKs I play with.  The SK can still outagro me but thats always been true.  Its not even close how much better I can take damage when I can actually draw agro.
2) They didn't eliminate the the proc agro effect...they reduced it (right in patch message). This impacted ALL classes & not just warriors. To be honest in 5 hours of Howling Stones last night Ididn't notice the difference (i.e. with my Bloodpoint & werewolf form I still saw plenty of agro).
3) Warriors were only "useless" the first 6 months of the games existence...I know I experienced it first hand (same armor, weapons & hps as everyone else with zero distinguishing skills) .  These days with decent warr specific armor & weapons we tank very well at most levels.
4) The idea that warriors don't contribute significant offensive damage is an old idea.  With the uber hps high level MOBs the damage we contribute over time is quite significant.
5) Raising the defensive caps for the other classes actually makes them stronger in the groups I play in.  That means my groups survive more. I kind of like that.
6) The mid 30s-40s is a tough spot for warriors.  Mostly because the other tank classes (Rangers/SKs in particular) have similar agro capability to ourselves at this point but little experience in the value of their role in a group.  By the mid 40s very few Rangers, SKs & Pallies are actively trying wrest agro away from a warrior...at least if they have any brains.

regards

Flair Shieldrender
54 Champion Fennin Ro

James Wofford wrote:
sigh..  Things are not as bad as you guys think.

Warriors CAN still tank better then paladins and sks.  We were never meant
to be the ultimate damage dealers.  It has just evolved to everyone thinking
we have to dish mad damage to keep the critter on us to do our job.  The
only thing they have hosed us with is the ability to taunt in higher level
situations.  And to top that off, they remove the taunt to our proccing
weapons.

No one has the amount of HP we have, no one has the AC we have.  No one can
eat damage and stay live like we do.

Find a group where people play their classes instead of just go kill things
and you will see what I mean.  If the ranger is getting his ass kicked
because he is outdamaging us, then he is not doing his job and is putting
the whole group in danger because the cle!
ric is spending their mana to keep!
him alive.  Remember, a 600mana rez is alot more mana efficient then 3 comps
and a bunch of smaller heals to keep that ranger kicking.  If the paladin or
sk is tanking, then they are not doing their job because they are not taking
the damage as well as a warrior.  It is all about how you play your class,
not what abilities you have or dont have.

Daks
Warlord of Rallos Zek
Stormrider of Quellious

-----Original Message-----
From: Tom Swift [mailto:tswift@...]

Not to mention rangers!!

SoW at 30
Offense and weapons skills upgraded to match warrior.

WTF? Why am I playing a warrior?

Kinrea Keres
